snippet: A new bill provides a 13-year path to citizenship for the 11 million illegal immigrants already in the country.
abstract: Bipartisan group of eight senators working on plan to overhaul nation's immigration laws reach agreement that illegal immigrants who arrived in the country after Dec 31, 2011, could be ineligible to apply for legal status, and potentially citizenship; bill will provide a 13-year path to citizenship for the 11 million illegal immigrants already living in the United States.
lead_paragraph: A new bill provides a 13-year path to citizenship for the 11 million illegal immigrants already in the country.

headline.seo: Immigration Plan Sets 2011 Cutoff Date for Eligibility
headline.main: Immigration Plan Sets 2011 Cutoff for Path to Legalization
headline.print_headline: Immigration Overhaul Proposal to Set 2011 Cutoff for Eligibility for Legal Status
